message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CL, cs.MM 

This paper deals with the problem of weakly-supervised semantic segmentation, which is a subfield of computer vision (cs.CV). The proposed approach involves using classification networks and adversarial erasing to progressively mine object regions, which is a technique that falls under the umbrella of machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also mentions the use of segmentation learning, which is a subfield of natural language processing (cs.CL). Finally, the paper evaluates its approach on the PASCAL VOC dataset, which is commonly used in multimedia (cs.MM) research.
